name: Clumber Park Lakeside Walk, Clumber Park

ai.summary: A challenging 17.5 km loop around Clumber Park’s lakeside areas, combining woodland paths with open parkland. The route is long and strenuous, with varied surfaces and some sections requiring careful footing, making it best suited for experienced hikers.
ai.terrain_summary: Varied terrain including gravel and tarmac paths, wooden boardwalks by the lakes, grassy and muddy sections, and occasional uneven ground. Expect gentle to moderate elevation changes and exposed shores with wind.
ai.safety_notes: Plan the walk for daylight hours; check weather and park opening times. The route is long and strenuous; pace yourself and take breaks. Wear sturdy boots with good grip and bring waterproof clothing. Stay on marked paths, watch for muddy or slippery sections near the water, and be cautious of crowds in the park. Bring plenty of water and snacks, a map or GPS, and a fully charged phone. Let someone know your planned start and finish times. Dogs are allowed in most areas but keep them on a leash where required; be mindful of wildlife and other visitors. In case of an emergency, contact park rangers.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good grip
Map or GPS device; fully charged phone
Headlamp or flashlight (in case of late finish)
ai.best_seasons: Spring to Autumn (roughly March–October) when paths are drier, wildlife is active, and daylight is longer.

seo.title: Clumber Park Lakeside Walk – 17.5 km hard lakeside hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Explore a 17.5 km lakeside loop around Clumber Park. A challenging UK hike featuring water views, boardwalks, and varied terrain. Plan your trip now.
